positive_phenotypes: The proband presented with severe hepatopathy, neurological deterioration, early developmental delay, motor weakness, intellectual disability, and epileptic seizure. These phenotypes are consistent with WARS2 deficiency.

The proband exhibited a range of severe clinical features, including axial hypotonia, hyper-tonia, dystonic posturing, and delayed cognitive and motor development. Optic atrophy and generalized amyotrophy were also observed.
The proband exhibited a range of clinical phenotypes, including developmental delay, motor weakness, intellectual disability, seizures, and acute liver failure.
The proband exhibited a range of clinical phenotypes, including hepatopathy, encephalopathy, muscular hypotonia, cardiomyopathy, retinitis pigmentosa, Parkinson-like symptoms, dystonia, and ptosis.
No clinical phenotypes were associated with positive probands.

quote_snippets.quote: The first subjects with deficiency of mitochondrial tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase (WARS2) were reported in 2017. Their clinical characteristics can be subdivided into three phenotypes (neonatal phenotype, severe infantile onset phenotype, Parkinson-like phenotype).
Severe hepatopathy and neurological deterioration after start of valproate treatment in a 6-year-old child with mitochondrial tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase deficiency.
This case report illustrates that the course of the disease in subjects with a mitochondrial defect can be non-progressive during several years.

quote_snippets.num_tested_probands: The proband was the only individual tested.
quote_snippets.text: The proband was born at term from non-consanguineous parents. The neonatal period was without complications.
When examined at the age of eleven months, severe axial hypotonia, hyper-tonia and dystonic posturing of arms and legs were noticed and she was found to have slight dysmorphic features.

quote_snippets.positive_phenotypes: The proband exhibited a range of severe clinical features, including axial hypotonia, hyper-tonia, dystonic posturing, and delayed cognitive and motor development. Optic atrophy and generalized amyotrophy were also observed.
quote_snippets.text: She had no head control and rigidity of arms and legs was noticed. Fists were bilaterally clenched.

quote_snippets.num_compound_or_double_hets: No compound or double heterozygous mutations were identified.
quote_snippets.text: The urinary organic acid profile showed high concentrations of lactate, pyruvate, 3-OH-butyrate and 3-keto-butyrate.

quote_snippets.num_tested_probands: The proband was the only individual tested.
quote_snippets.text: The proposita had presented at young age with developmental delay, motor weakness and intellectual disability. Her condition remained stable for several years until she presented for the first time with seizures

quote_snippets.text: A subject with WARS2 deficiency was reported to have a mosaic pattern after activity staining of cytochrome c oxidase. Hepatocytes with strong mito-chondrial activity were found adjacent to cells that showed scarce or no reaction product (Fig. 1c-d).

quote_snippets.num_positive_het_probands: No heterozygous proband was identified in this report.
quote_snippets.text: Immunohistochemical staining of OXPHOS enzymes in the liver of one subject reported by Wortmann et al. demonstrated severely reduced quantity of the complexes I and IV.

quote_snippets.positive_phenotypes: The proband exhibited a range of clinical phenotypes, including hepatopathy, encephalopathy, muscular hypotonia, cardiomyopathy, retinitis pigmentosa, Parkinson-like symptoms, dystonia, and ptosis.
quote_snippets.text: A wide variety of brain MRI abnormalities were found in the WARS2 deficient subjects. In the subject reported by Theissen et al. (2017), a delay of myelination, diffuse cerebral atrophy and moderate symmetric ventriculomegaly was described [9].

quote_snippets.num_compound_or_double_hets: No compound or double heterozygous mutations were identified in this report.
quote_snippets.text: Single person WES was performed in order to pinpoint the underlying molecular defect. Two variants were found in WARS2. One was a frameshift mutation (c.797delC, p.Pro266Argf-sTer10), the other a missense mutation (c.938 A > T, p.Lys313Met).
